channel.title: How do "Dedicated" servers work?
channel.description:
Ok so I've been thinking about making my server dedicated, but I have know Idea how it works. lol. So my questions are:
1. Can you still update your server once it is dedicated? (code it, etc)
2. Is there a website that you can pay for one cheap?
3. Do you like give them your server's file or somthing? Or make a website for your server?
Thanks.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 17, 2008, 11:28:14 AM[/size][hr]Anyone?

item.title: How do "Dedicated" servers work?
item.dc:creator: @Patrickftw Patrickftw
item.description:
@Patrickftw wrote:

Log into it via remote desktop, Copy your files and paste in the remote desktop screen. Remote desktop is like connecting to another computer from yours via Ip.

Start Menu > All Programs > Communications > Remote desktop.

You control everything from there.

Read full topic

item.title: How do "Dedicated" servers work?
item.dc:creator: @pwnedurmom pwnedurmom
item.description:
@pwnedurmom wrote:

im pretty shure im right because it’s not named dedicated server it’s called
dedicated hoster same as someone hosting for you

item.title: How do "Dedicated" servers work?
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

No I think you have your own place to upload your server and every time you update it you can upload it and then it will run for you.

Read full topic

item.title: How do "Dedicated" servers work?
item.dc:creator: @pwnedurmom pwnedurmom
item.description:
@pwnedurmom wrote:

i think its the same as a hoster but

  1. you send updates to them and they code it into your server
  2. you controll uptime downtime
  3. and yes i think it is payed hosting
